sen.j: 永禄5年（1562年）に織田信長が初めて入洛した際に父・信秀の追善菩提のために羽柴秀吉（後の豊臣秀吉）に命じて黄梅庵を建立した。
sen.e: Nobunaga ODA ordered Hideyoshi HASHIBA (later Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI) to construct Obai-an Temple to pray for the soul of his father Nobuhide when he first entered Kyoto in 1562.

sen.j: 天正10年（1582年）の本能寺の変で信長が急逝すると秀吉は黄梅庵を改築するが、主君の塔所（墓所）としては規模が小さすぎるという理由で信長の法名・総見院殿の名を採り、大徳寺内に別に総見院を建立した。
sen.e: Hideyoshi reconstructed Obai-an after the sudden death of Nobunaga during the Honnoji Incident but built Soken-in Temple, which was named after Sokeninden, the posthumous Buddhist name of Nobunaga, within the precinct of Daitoku-ji Temple as he believed that Obai-an Temple was too small to serve as the burial place of his master.
